instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMCâ€™s voltage sensors & other sensors..
definitions.U5000: What is U5000? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in macbooks from 2013-2015.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
Hi,

Board not turning on, when i check voltage <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all main voltage is up and down ( like <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8v ~ 12v),

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is not stable (0,8v ~ 3v)

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> stable 3.4v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> stable 3.3v

replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>,<CHIP>U4900</CHIP> but nothing change, only when i removed <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> pin all voltage is stable...

any offer for next step?

Thanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  should be low. 3 v makes it think you press the button,
check <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message: What is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> reading with <CHIP>U5000</CHIP> on? <CHIP>U4900</CHIP> or <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> is probably F'd and causing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> to fluctuate if there is no issue with <CHIP>U5000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
First thanks for answers.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.4V and <SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> is 3.1v, also replaced <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> nothing changed..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
I think my mistake is L means didnt understand. if 3.3V is <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> its ok ( i measured working board its shows same voltage at same pin) also Luis was published about this topic. i haveto watch it again.

So board have different problem. Maybe second SMC is same problem :( any suggestion ??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
_L means the signal is present when it is low in voltage.

For example, <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>, this is 3.42.v When you press the power button it goes down to 0 or 0.5v, something low, and then it thinks you're hitting the power button and the machine turns on. because you hit the ONOFF button.

is there any corrosion on this board that you can see, green or funny looking stuff?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message:
When i checked carefully nothing seems corrosion . But some one worked on GPU before come to mydesk:(
What ever i think spend enough time on this board send it back....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is fluctuationing
threads.message: I'd still check for a short on the GPU core or VRAM power bus. Could be fucked GPU after idiot did a reflow.
